answers.text: larger than all the Balkan economies combined

qas.question: What rank does Greece hold as an Albania investor?
What rank does Greece hold as an Bulgaria investor?
Greece is the largest foreign investor of what area?

context: With an economy <a0_0>larger than all the Balkan economies combined<a0_0/>, Greece is the largest economy in the Balkans, and an important regional investor. Greece is the <a1_0>number-two<a1_0/> foreign investor of capital in Albania, the <a2_0>number-three<a2_0/> foreign investor in Bulgaria, at the top-three of foreign investors in Romania and Serbia and the most important trading partner and largest foreign investor of the <a3_0>Republic of Macedonia<a3_0/>. Greek banks open a new branch somewhere in the Balkans on an almost weekly basis. The <a4_0>Greek telecommunications company<a4_0/> OTE has become a strong investor in Yugoslavia and other Balkan countries.
